record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JUNE 17, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JUNE 17, 2008 -- (Senate - June 16, 2008)

[Page: S5666]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, June 17; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, the Senate proceed to a period of morning business for up to 1 hour, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the majority controlling the second half; that following morning business, the Senate resume consideration of the

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
